We test them

2All

At this point, we do not need no alpha or beta testing, is now grinding detail, so that the next release of the patch did not follow. In the future, we certainly need a dedicated person who will test the beta version, but that we will think later.

I love your DEMVs. Pls do more. The best addon for KSP.
Just a thought; Are you going to make the living modules towable? I can just imagine a DEMV towing a chain base.

Just a thought; Are you going to make the living modules towable? I can just imagine a DEMV towing a chain base.

Now, who told you that? It's a secret...shhhh.

Hey Guys! Great work with this mod! Just wanted to point something out. The DEMV Mk.II Fuel tank has the same mass for when it is empty as when it is full. Also, the weight of the propellant is very little in comparison to the other propellant used in the LFTs. I have made a CFG edit on my own, but I thought I might let you guys know.

Hey Guys! Great work with this mod! Just wanted to point something out. The DEMV Mk.II Fuel tank has the same mass for when it is empty as when it is full. Also, the weight of the propellant is very little in comparison to the other propellant used in the LFTs. I have made a CFG edit on my own, but I thought I might let you guys know.

Yeah, I know. The earlier DEMVs are a little unbalanced. Bobcat was working alone and had a lot to do. Game balancing takes a lot of work, and he did a great job considering the solo performance. We're considering revamping them, but we also have to consider that we'd probably break persistence for people's existing designs.

However:

The Mk4 RAT has had extensive play testing and game balancing. Not only will the Mk4 be the best looking and best animated Bobcat Ind. release to date, but it will be extremely well balanced to the stock game parts. You will have to carefully select fuel loads, engines and landing configurations. Also, as stated earlier, now you must consider mass balance, both in vertical launch and horizontal landing settings.

...and this is just the beginning....

Sounds interesting!
